history.content:
For EECS: Technical courses (Math, Sciences, Engineering classes) cannot be taken for P/NP unless you meet the criteria outlined below. Any student who does not meet this criteria must take all technical classes for a letter grade. If we receive notice that a student is in a technical class for P/NP we will have the Office of the Registrar change it to a letter grade. This applies to all technical classes regardless if they satisfy a major requirement or not.

 

Graduating seniors in their final semester (must be on the degree list) can take a technical class P/NP if they do not need it for their major requirements. You have to change it by the 5th week of school. After the 5th week date you cannot take a technical class for P/NP. No petitions will be accepted.
No, even if a course is not being used for a requirement, all technical courses must be taken for a letter grade.

children.subject: For the L&S CS majors, students can take courses p/np if they are not using the course as a major requirement.

history.subject: can eecs majors take grad school cs courses (like cs270) P/NP?
can eecs majors take grad school cs courses P/NP?
